attributes.action: Fund the £200 million for Thomas Cook and save the tax payer £600 million.
attributes.additional_details: Its not just TC - airport handlers, fuel providers, hoteliers, airport staff, small tour operators, independent travel agents - the economic impact will be massive.
attributes.background: 1000's of jobs in the UK and around the world are dependent on Thomas Cook survival. It would cost the gov £600m in tax payers money just to repatriate everyone. Then there will be mass bankruptcies of other travel companies (at least 165 in one go).

rejection.details:
Thomas Cook entered into insolvency proceedings and ceased trading on Monday 23 September.

The Government has published advice for customers and employees. You can find out more here:

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/are-you-a-customer-or-employee-affected-by-thomas-cook

The Secretary of State for Transport made an oral statement in the House of Commons on 26 September. You can read the statement here:

https://www.gov.uk/government/speeches/thomas-cook-update

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.
